title: Haddenham Walks

images.title: Michael Trolove / Cottages beyond Haddenham duck pond
images.caption: Cottages beyond Haddenham duck pond

images.title: D Gore / St Mary the Virgin’s Church, Haddenham
images.caption: St Mary the Virgins Church. The parish of Haddenham is mostly bounded by water, the river Thame and its tributaries, and this pond beside the church is a suitable reminder of one of the old local industries  Aylesbury duck breeding. The large church is essentially 13th century when it was rebuilt, including its tower  now with a peal of eight bells cast in 1809.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Cuddington: The Green
images.caption: Cuddington: The Green. The black post records Cuddington's success in winning Buckinghamshire's Best Kept Village competition, most recently in 2005. Beyond that, and protected by the four white posts, is the village pump.

description: This picturesque Buckinghamshire based village includes a pretty duck pond, a fine old church and quaint thatched cottages. There's also some excellent walking through the surrounding countryside of the Thame Valley. This circular walk from the village visits the neighbouring settlements of Dinton, Nether Winchendon and Cuddington. There's also nice views of the River Thame and a visit to the attractive Eythrope Park Estate to enjoy on the way. The trail makes use of the Aylesbury Ring and the Thame Valley Walk, two long distance waymarked footpaths which run through the countryside surrounding the village. In the villages there's quaint thatched cottages and historic churches to see.
